title: Outcast Hill
text:
Outcast Hill is an isolated <a href="hill">hill</a> in northern <a href="British%20Columbia">British Columbia</a>, <a href="Canada">Canada</a>, located southeast of <a href="Mess%20Lake%2C%20British%20Columbia">Mess Lake</a>. It lies at the southern end of <a href="Mount%20Edziza%20Provincial%20Park">Mount Edziza Provincial Park</a>.
History.
Outcast Hill was named on 2 January 1980 by the <a href="Geological%20Survey%20of%20Canada">Geological Survey of Canada</a> after the Wetalth people, a group of people who lived here in times past, outcast or exiled from the Tahltans.
Geology.
Outcast Hill is a volcanic feature associated with the <a href="Spectrum%20Range">Spectrum Range</a> volcanic complex which in turn form part of the <a href="Northern%20Cordilleran%20Volcanic%20Province">Northern Cordilleran Volcanic Province</a>. It is a <a href="cinder%20cone">cinder cone</a> that formed in the <a href="Pleistocene">Pleistocene</a> period.
